text: <a href="../1-Samuel-23-1/" title="1 Samuel 23:1 KJV verse detail"><span id="3" class="versehover">1 Then they told David, saying, Behold, the Philistines fight against Keilah, and they rob the threshingfloors.

<a href="../1-Samuel-23-2/" title="1 Samuel 23:2 KJV verse detail"><span id="4" class="versehover">2 Therefore David enquired of the LORD, saying, Shall I go and smite these Philistines? And the LORD said unto David, Go, and smite the Philistines, and save Keilah.

<a href="../1-Samuel-23-3/" title="1 Samuel 23:3 KJV verse detail"><span id="5" class="versehover">3 And David's men said unto him, Behold, we be afraid here in Judah: how much more then if we come to Keilah against the armies of the Philistines?

<a href="../1-Samuel-23-4/" title="1 Samuel 23:4 KJV verse detail"><span id="6" class="versehover">4 Then David enquired of the LORD yet again. And the LORD answered him and said, Arise, go down to Keilah; for I will deliver the Philistines into thine hand.

<a href="../1-Samuel-23-5/" title="1 Samuel 23:5 KJV verse detail"><span id="7" class="versehover">5 So David and his men went to Keilah, and fought with the Philistines, and brought away their cattle, and smote them with a great slaughter. So David saved the inhabitants of Keilah.

<a href="../1-Samuel-23-6/" title="1 Samuel 23:6 KJV verse detail"><span id="8" class="versehover">6 And it came to pass, when Abiathar the son of Ahimelech fled to David to Keilah, *that* he came down *with* an ephod in his hand.

<a href="../1-Samuel-23-7/" title="1 Samuel 23:7 KJV verse detail"><span id="9" class="versehover">7 And it was told Saul that David was come to Keilah. And Saul said, God hath delivered him into mine hand; for he is shut in, by entering into a town that hath gates and bars.

<a href="../1-Samuel-23-8/" title="1 Samuel 23:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8 And Saul called all the people together to war, to go down to Keilah, to besiege David and his men.

<a href="../1-Samuel-23-9/" title="1 Samuel 23:9 KJV verse detail"><span id="11" class="versehover">9 And David knew that Saul secretly practised mischief against him; and he said to Abiathar the priest, Bring hither the ephod.

<a href="../1-Samuel-23-10/" title="1 Samuel 23:10 KJV verse detail"><span id="12" class="versehover">10 Then said David, O LORD God of Israel, thy servant hath certainly heard that Saul seeketh to come to Keilah, to destroy the city for my sake.

<a href="../1-Samuel-23-11/" title="1 Samuel 23:11 KJV verse detail"><span id="13" class="versehover">11 Will the men of Keilah deliver me up into his hand? will Saul come down, as thy servant hath heard? O LORD God of Israel, I beseech thee, tell thy servant. And the LORD said, He will come down.

<a href="../1-Samuel-23-12/" title="1 Samuel 23:12 KJV verse detail"><span id="14" class="versehover">12 Then said David, Will the men of Keilah deliver me and my men into the hand of Saul? And the LORD said, They will deliver *thee* up.

<a href="../1-Samuel-23-13/" title="1 Samuel 23:13 KJV verse detail"><span id="15" class="versehover">13 Then David and his men, *which were* about six hundred, arose and departed out of Keilah, and went whithersoever they could go. And it was told Saul that David was escaped from Keilah; and he forbare to go forth.

<a href="../1-Samuel-23-14/" title="1 Samuel 23:14 KJV verse detail"><span id="16" class="versehover">14 And David abode in the wilderness in strong holds, and remained in a mountain in the wilderness of Ziph. And Saul sought him every day, but God delivered him not into his hand.

<a href="../1-Samuel-23-15/" title="1 Samuel 23:15 KJV verse detail"><span id="17" class="versehover">15 And David saw that Saul was come out to seek his life: and David *was* in the wilderness of Ziph in a wood.

<a href="../1-Samuel-23-16/" title="1 Samuel 23:16 KJV verse detail"><span id="18" class="versehover">16 And Jonathan Saul's son arose, and went to David into the wood, and strengthened his hand in God.

<a href="../1-Samuel-23-17/" title="1 Samuel 23:17 KJV verse detail"><span id="19" class="versehover">17 And he said unto him, Fear not: for the hand of Saul my father shall not find thee; and thou shalt be king over Israel, and I shall be next unto thee; and that also Saul my father knoweth.

<a href="../1-Samuel-23-18/" title="1 Samuel 23:18 KJV verse detail"><span id="20" class="versehover">18 And they two made a covenant before the LORD: and David abode in the wood, and Jonathan went to his house.

<a href="../1-Samuel-23-19/" title="1 Samuel 23:19 KJV verse detail"><span id="21" class="versehover">19 Then came up the Ziphites to Saul to Gibeah, saying, Doth not David hide himself with us in strong holds in the wood, in the hill of Hachilah, which *is* on the south of Jeshimon?

<a href="../1-Samuel-23-20/" title="1 Samuel 23:20 KJV verse detail"><span id="22" class="versehover">20 Now therefore, O king, come down according to all the desire of thy soul to come down; and our part *shall be* to deliver him into the king's hand.
<a href="../1-Samuel-23-21/" title="1 Samuel 23:21 KJV verse detail"><span id="23" class="versehover">21 And Saul said, Blessed *be* ye of the LORD; for ye have compassion on me.

<a href="../1-Samuel-23-22/" title="1 Samuel 23:22 KJV verse detail"><span id="24" class="versehover">22 Go, I pray you, prepare yet, and know and see his place where his haunt is, *and* who hath seen him there: for it is told me *that* he dealeth very subtilly.

<a href="../1-Samuel-23-23/" title="1 Samuel 23:23 KJV verse detail"><span id="25" class="versehover">23 See therefore, and take knowledge of all the lurking places where he hideth himself, and come ye again to me with the certainty, and I will go with you: and it shall come to pass, if he be in the land, that I will search him out throughout all the thousands of Judah.

<a href="../1-Samuel-23-24/" title="1 Samuel 23:24 KJV verse detail"><span id="26" class="versehover">24 And they arose, and went to Ziph before Saul: but David and his men *were* in the wilderness of Maon, in the plain on the south of Jeshimon.

<a href="../1-Samuel-23-25/" title="1 Samuel 23:25 KJV verse detail"><span id="27" class="versehover">25 Saul also and his men went to seek *him*. And they told David: wherefore he came down into a rock, and abode in the wilderness of Maon. And when Saul heard *that*, he pursued after David in the wilderness of Maon.

<a href="../1-Samuel-23-26/" title="1 Samuel 23:26 KJV verse detail"><span id="28" class="versehover">26 And Saul went on this side of the mountain, and David and his men on that side of the mountain: and David made haste to get away for fear of Saul; for Saul and his men compassed David and his men round about to take them.

<a href="../1-Samuel-23-27/" title="1 Samuel 23:27 KJV verse detail"><span id="29" class="versehover">27 But there came a messenger unto Saul, saying, Haste thee, and come; for the Philistines have invaded the land.

<a href="../1-Samuel-23-28/" title="1 Samuel 23:28 KJV verse detail"><span id="30" class="versehover">28 Wherefore Saul returned from pursuing after David, and went against the Philistines: therefore they called that place Selahammahlekoth.
<a href="../1-Samuel-23-29/" title="1 Samuel 23:29 KJV verse detail"><span id="31" class="versehover">29 And David went up from thence, and dwelt in strong holds at Engedi.
